bill_title: provide driver licensing stations and provide the same level of service at each station as was prior to October 1, 2009.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide driver licensing stations and provide the same level of service at each station as was prior to October 1, 2009. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The Office of Driver Licensing within the Department of Public Safety shall provide driver licensing stations in each of the municipalities that had a station prior to October 1, 2009. This includes stations in the following municipalities within South Dakota: Buffalo, Bison, Lemmon, McIntosh, Faith, Dupree, Timber Lake, Mobridge, Mound City, Eureka, Leola, Ipswich, Aberdeen, Belle Fourche, Spearfish, Sturgis, Rapid City, Custer, Hot Springs, Wall, Pine Ridge, Martin, Kadoka, Gettysburg, Onida, Pierre, Murdo, White River, Kennebec, Winner, Burke, Faulkton, Highmore, Miller, Redfield, Wessington Springs, Chamberlain, Armour, Sisseton, Webster, Milbank, Watertown, Hayti, Huron, Woonsocket, Plankinton, Mitchell, Brookings, Madison, Parker, Yankton, Vermillion, Elk Point, North Sioux City, Deadwood, Philip, Mission, Britton, Howard, Tyndall, Parkston, Salem, Freeman, Canton, Flandreau, Clark, Clear Lake, De Smet, Platte, Beresford, Wagner, and two stations in Sioux Falls. Section 2. The Office of Driver Licensing within the Department of Public Safety shall maintain the same level of service at each driver licensing station, listed in section 1 of this Act, as was provided prior to October 1, 2009. Section 3. Before any change to the driver licensing stations listed in section 1 of this Act and level of service as required in section 2 of this Act, the Department of Public Safety must submit a detailed cost and FTE analysis to the Legislature. The analysis shall include the before and after effect of such proposed change. If the Legislature approves the change, the Department of Public Safety may implement the change.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
